title.narrative: USAID Small Grants Program and Ambassadorâ€™s Fund

description.narrative: (Pakistan): The Small Grants Program will support small-to-medium sized projects that advance USAID's strategic objectives in the region. This cross-cutting program will serve as the Mission's principal regional fund for locally-focused regional projects and provides pooled resources to support experimental or pilot-level project activities that complement USAID's overall country strategy. This program enables USAID to respond to the very best of hundreds of unsolicited applications and makes non-competitive awards for unique and innovative project proposals.The U.S. Ambassador's Fund will support small community-driven initiatives aimed at improving basic economic or social conditions. The Fund provides significant opportunities for the U.S. Ambassador to respond directly to community-identified needs. ~It also contributes substantially to the Mission's broader public diplomacy objectives by improving visibility of U.S. non-Government to Government assistance. The U.S. Ambassador has identified five priority thematic areas for the Fund: wildlife conservation; women's issues (HUR), entrepreneurship; water and sanitation (WASH); and, cultural preservation.
